definitions.definition: To make a gesture in honor of (someone or something).
examples: They saluted the flag as it passed in the parade.

definitions.definition: To act in thanks, honor , or tribute ; to thank or extend gratitude ; to praise .
examples: I would like to salute the many dedicated volunteers that make this project possible.

definitions.definition: to wave, to acknowledge an acquaintance.
examples: I saluted Bill at the concert, but he didn't see me through the crowd.

definitions.definition: To address , as with expressions of kind wishes and courtesy; to greet; to hail.
To promote the welfare and safety of; to benefit; to gratify.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To make a gesture in honor of (someone or something).
secondary_definitions: To act in thanks, honor , or tribute ; to thank or extend gratitude ; to praise .
( Ireland , informal ) to wave, to acknowledge an acquaintance.
To address , as with expressions of kind wishes and courtesy; to greet; to hail.
To promote the welfare and safety of; to benefit; to gratify.
